newsitem.title: UK: UK Foreign Secretary leaving wife for secretary.
newsitem.headline: UK Foreign Secretary leaving wife for secretary.

text.p: British Foreign Secretary Robin Cook announced on Saturday that he is leaving his wife of 28 years for his parliamentary secretary.
Cook made the shock announcement after the News of The World tabloid splashed a front-page story for its Sunday edition under the headline: "Cabinet minister and his secret love."
Prime Minister Tony Blair, holidaying in Italy, said he viewed the announcement as a personal tragedy but stressed that the breakup in no way affected Cook's job in government.

The 50-year-old foreign secretary, one of the leaders of Britain's new Labour government, confirmed he was leaving his 51-year-old wife Margaret for Gaynor Regan, 41, his trusted aide for the past five years.
"I want to make clear that the responsibility for this is entirely mine," Cook said in a statement.
"I accept that I am a public figure but I would ask for the privacy of those involved to be respected at a very painful time."

A spokesman for Blair, who three months ago swept to a landslide election victory, said: "He sees this as a personal tragedy for those involved which does not affect Robin Cook's capability as a truly outstanding foreign secretary."
